intro: Callianthemum anemonoides, commonly known as the Alpine anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately lobed and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five to eight petals and numerous stamens. Callianthemum anemonoides thrives in rocky or alpine environments and is often found in meadows and slopes at high elevations.
